turns.content:
To ensure a smooth trip and avoid disappointment, it's a good idea to book or reserve the following activities and experiences in advance:

1. Hotel Accommodation: Book your stay at the Hilton New Orleans Riverside to secure your desired dates and room preferences.
2. Ghost/Voodoo Tour: Reserve your spot on the Ghost Tour with Robert Florence, Haunted History Tours, or the 6-in-1 Haunted Tour with the Voodoo Bone Lady, depending on your preference.
3. Steamboat Natchez Cruise: Purchase tickets for the Steamboat Natchez Mississippi River cruise in advance to guarantee your desired time and date.
4. Restaurant Reservations: Make reservations at popular restaurants, especially for dinner, as they can fill up quickly. This includes restaurants like Commander's Palace, GW Fins, Coop's Place, Dooky Chase's Restaurant, and Herbsaint.
5. National WWII Museum: While not always necessary, you can buy tickets online in advance to avoid waiting in line at the museum.
6. Live Music Venues: Some music venues, like Preservation Hall, may require advance ticket purchases or reservations for specific shows.

By booking these activities and experiences in advance, you can ensure a hassle-free trip and make the most of your time in New Orleans. Additionally, always check for any changes in operating hours, availability, or COVID-19 related restrictions before making reservations or visiting attractions.
What's so great about the Dooky Chase Restaurant? can I go there for lunch on Friday?

Dooky Chase's Restaurant is a historic and iconic eatery in New Orleans, established in 1941. It is located in the Treme neighborhood and is famous for its Creole cuisine, especially its gumbo, fried chicken, and other Southern favorites. The restaurant was founded by Emily and Dooky Chase Sr. and gained popularity during the Civil Rights Movement as a gathering place for activists, politicians, and artists.

Leah Chase, the late wife of Dooky Chase Jr., was known as the "Queen of Creole Cuisine" and played a significant role in the restaurant's success. The restaurant also houses an impressive collection of African American art, making it a cultural hub in New Orleans.

Dooky Chase's Restaurant serves lunch on weekdays from 11:00 AM to 3:00 PM. You can definitely plan to visit for lunch on Friday. It is advisable to call ahead and check if reservations are necessary or if there are any special events that may affect the restaurant's regular hours.

To include Dooky Chase's Restaurant in your itinerary, consider adjusting your Friday schedule as follows:

1:00 PM: Stop for lunch at Dooky Chase's Restaurant
2:30 PM: Continue your French Quarter tour, visiting Bourbon Street, Royal Street, and other historic sites

This way, you can enjoy the delicious Creole cuisine and the rich history of Dooky Chase's Restaurant during your trip.
I want to have dinner after the Ghost tour, that ends at 9:30 PM. What are some places near the hotel that have foor and live music until late?

If you'd like to have dinner and enjoy live music after your Ghost Tour, there are several options near the Hilton New Orleans Riverside that are open late. Here are a few recommendations:

1. House of Blues New Orleans: Located just a short walk from your hotel, House of Blues offers a variety of food options and live music performances, including local and national acts. The restaurant and bar typically remain open until midnight, while concerts and events may run later.
2. The Howlin' Wolf: This music venue, located in the Warehouse District, offers live music performances, ranging from blues to rock and beyond. The Howlin' Wolf also features an on-site bar and food from the Howlin' Wolf Den, which serves classic New Orleans cuisine. Check their schedule for performances and hours.
3. Three Muses: Situated in the French Quarter, Three Muses offers a cozy atmosphere with live music, creative cocktails, and a diverse menu. While the kitchen typically closes around 10 PM, the bar and live music often continue until midnight or later.
4. The Carousel Bar & Lounge: Located inside the historic Hotel Monteleone, this unique, rotating bar offers live music, craft cocktails, and a limited food menu. The bar is open until midnight or later, depending on the day of the week.

Please note that the availability of live music, operating hours, and reservation requirements may vary. It is a good idea to call ahead or check the venue's website for the most up-to-date information and schedules.

To accommodate a late dinner, you can adjust your Friday evening itinerary as follows:

8:00 PM: Join the Ghost Tour with your chosen provider
9:30 PM: Wrap up the tour and head to your chosen restaurant or music venue for dinner and live music
11:30 PM - 12:00 AM: Head back to your hotel after enjoying dinner and live music
Ok, I'll go to house of blues

Great choice! The House of Blues New Orleans offers a fun atmosphere with delicious food and live music. To include the House of Blues in your Friday evening itinerary, please see the adjusted schedule below:

8:00 PM: Join the Ghost Tour with your chosen provider
9:30 PM: Wrap up the tour and head to the House of Blues New Orleans for dinner and live music
11:30 PM - 12:00 AM: Head back to your hotel after enjoying dinner and live music at the House of Blues

Remember to check the House of Blues website or call ahead to confirm their schedule for live music performances and any reservation requirements. Enjoy your evening at the House of Blues and have a fantastic time in New Orleans!
Wait, the house of blues closes at 10PM. I need some place that will stay open until 12AM

I apologize for the confusion. Here is an alternative option for a late-night dinner and live music experience near the Hilton New Orleans Riverside:

1. Bar Marilou: Located in the Warehouse District, Bar Marilou offers a sophisticated atmosphere with craft cocktails, a selection of small plates, and live music or DJ sets on select nights. The bar is open until midnight or later, depending on the day of the week. While the food menu is limited, you can still enjoy a late-night snack and great music. Check their website or call ahead to confirm live music schedules and hours of operation.

To include Bar Marilou in your Friday evening itinerary, the adjusted schedule is as follows:

8:00 PM: Join the Ghost Tour with your chosen provider
9:30 PM: Wrap up the tour and head to Bar Marilou for a late-night snack, drinks, and live music
11:30 PM - 12:00 AM: Head back to your hotel after enjoying your time at Bar Marilou

Alternatively, you can also check out other bars and clubs in the French Quarter, as many of them offer live music and late-night dining options. Keep in mind that schedules and hours may vary, so it's always a good idea to confirm in advance.
I'll go to Fritzel's European Jazz Pub

Fritzel's European Jazz Pub is an excellent choice for enjoying live jazz music in a cozy, historic setting. Located in the heart of the French Quarter, Fritzel's features talented local musicians and offers a lively atmosphere.

To include Fritzel's European Jazz Pub in your Friday evening itinerary, please see the adjusted schedule below:

8:00 PM: Join the Ghost Tour with your chosen provider
9:30 PM: Wrap up the tour and head to Fritzel's European Jazz Pub for live jazz music
11:30 PM - 12:00 AM: Head back to your hotel after enjoying live music at Fritzel's

Please note that Fritzel's European Jazz Pub does not have a full food menu, but they do offer some light snacks. You may want to consider having a late dinner or a substantial snack before heading to Fritzel's, or you can explore nearby dining options in the French Quarter for a quick bite.

As always, check Fritzel's website or call ahead to confirm their schedule for live music performances and hours of operation. Enjoy your evening at Fritzel's European Jazz Pub and have a fantastic time in New Orleans!
I prefer better food, so I'll go to Palm Court Jazz Cafe instead

Palm Court Jazz Cafe is a great choice for an authentic New Orleans experience, combining delicious Creole cuisine with live traditional jazz music. Located in the French Quarter, Palm Court Jazz Cafe offers a relaxed, elegant atmosphere where you can enjoy both dinner and entertainment.

To include Palm Court Jazz Cafe in your Friday evening itinerary, please see the adjusted schedule below:

8:00 PM: Join the Ghost Tour with your chosen provider
9:30 PM: Wrap up the tour and head to Palm Court Jazz Cafe for dinner and live jazz music
11:30 PM - 12:00 AM: Head back to your hotel after enjoying dinner and live music at Palm Court Jazz Cafe

Please note that Palm Court Jazz Cafe typically requires reservations for dinner, so be sure to book a table in advance. Additionally, check their website or call ahead to confirm their schedule for live music performances and hours of operation.

Enjoy your evening at Palm Court Jazz Cafe and have a wonderful time in New Orleans!
